question: As per the Kepler's third law, the square of the time period of revolution of a planet is directly proportional to which of the following?
option1: semi-major axis of its elliptical orbit
option2: cube root of semi-major axis of its elliptical orbit
option3: square of semi-major axis of its elliptical orbit
option4: cube of semi-major axis of its elliptical orbit
answer: cube of semi-major axis of its elliptical orbit
explanation: Kepler's third law: the square of the time period of revolution of a planet is directly proportional to the cube of semi-major axis of its elliptical orbit. It is also known as the Law of periods.
